intro: Pacouria boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian pacouria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils at moderate altitudes. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
